channel.title: R Markdown on Jack's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in R Markdown on Jack's Blog

item.title: Hello Blogdown!
item.description: â€¦Hello Netlify, Hello Hugo, Hello Tanka, Hello World! This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.

item.title: Test Post
item.description: library(dplyr) ## ## Attaching package: 'dplyr' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ## ## filter, lag ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ## ## intersect, setdiff, setequal, union test_func <- function(a,b){ return(a + b) } x <- rnorm(100, 5, 3) y <- rnorm(100, 5, 4) plot(x, y)
